page.title: 03FLORA
page.content: The rare Yellow Star of Bethlehem grows in one place on the Eden & the Primula Farinosa, Cowslip, Early Purple & Spotted Orchid are found in the limestone areas. { FOOTPATHS} The area abounds in well trodden footpaths mostly signposted, along the banks of the rivers & streams, through woodlands & across open moorland. As a general rule there is free access across agricultural land often by well maintained stiles & gates. Walking is a popular attraction for tourists, particularly those following the guided walks organised by the Ramblers Association in connection with the Dales Rail excursions using the Settle-Carlisle line. There is access to the river by means of paths & stiles.
